question: When did you move to San Francisco?
answer: I came to San Francisco in 1964.
source_text: okay my name is Suma rocker I came to San Francisco in 1964.

question: What was your initial experience with housing in San Francisco?
answer: I applied for Section 8; it took a while to get it, but I got it.
source_text: I live in San Francisco and I applied for section A it took a while to to get it but I got it

question: Where did you first live when you moved to California?
answer: I moved to Sacramento Street, I don't know if it's the Marina. My aunt lived there, so I stayed with her.
source_text: and so when you first moved to California what neighborhood did you move to oh and Sacramento Street I dont know is the marina I dont know Sacramento Street and yeah my aunt lived there so I came in stayed with my aunt

question: What neighborhoods have you lived in San Francisco?
answer: After Sacramento Street, I moved to Silver Terrace, Ingleside, and Diamond Heights.
source_text: so after you lived on Sacramento Street what was the next neighborhood that you moved to its been so long and Silver Terrace in Ingleside in Diamond Heights

question: Where do you currently live in San Francisco?
answer: I live in Diamond Heights and have been there for a few months.
source_text: what area of San Francisco do you live now now yes Diamond Heights and how long have you lived there a few months

question: What was your work experience like as a single parent?
answer: I worked for an oncologist as a medical assistant and in medical records at St. Luke's Hospital. Initially, I worked for Metropolitan Life Insurance. It was hard to afford housing with just one job, so I had to work late, and my children had to stay by themselves.
source_text: I worked for a oncologist Im a medical as a medical assistant and I also work in medical records at St Lukes Hospital but at the beginning and when my kids were young I used to work for the insurance company Metropolitan Life yes and as a single parent working those jobs were you able to afford housing which is working one job no it was hard I had to work later all the time in my children had to stay by theirselves

question: How did you learn about Section 8 housing assistance?
answer: A lady told me about Section 8 and advised me to apply for it while I was working at Metropolitan Insurance.
source_text: yeah I was a single mother and they went to school and its when a lady told me about Section 8 that should apply because I used to work Metropolitan insurance and so she she advised me to apply for Section 8

question: How long did it take to get accepted into Section 8?
answer: It took maybe six to eight months to get accepted into Section 8.
source_text: how long would you say it took you to get accepted onto section oh Maybe six months maybe no eight or six months yeah I started getting into the Section 8

question: Could you or your family stay in San Francisco without housing assistance?
answer: No, it's still expensive, and they would probably have to leave the Bay Area.
source_text: so you mentioned Section 8 as a way to pay for housing do you think you or your family members would be able to stay in San Francisco without any assistance from for housing no or still expensive and where do you think your family members would be right now if they didnt have section 8 or some kind of uh housing help do you think they would have to be with family members in San Francisco or do you think they would have to leave San Francisco or leave the Bay Area and they probably have to leave the Bay Area

question: Do you know any family members who had to leave the Bay Area due to housing costs?
answer: Yes, my oldest daughter moved to Massachusetts, and my granddaughter Felicia moved to Houston, Texas.
source_text: do you know family members that had to leave the Bay Area oh my daughter my oldest daughter yeah she moved added some cheese cooks too expensive here and granddaughter Felicia and where did they move my my daughter moved to Massachusetts Felicia moved to Houston Texas

question: What challenges do you face with your current living situation?
answer: I have memory issues, which makes cooking dangerous as I might forget and cause a fire. Previous apartments had a lot of stairs, which was hard, but transportation was good.
source_text: because sometimes I trip and life in I dont hear very well in in I cannot cook because I forget my my memory is bad because I started put something in the stuff and I forget and its dangerous because I can cause a fire yeah yeah previous Apartments they wear a lot of stairs yeah and it was hard yeah and yeah and the only thing was good there was Transportation
